byline.contributor: Edna Ishayik, Nate Schweber, John Surico and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting from New York. Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: Alarmed New Yorkers react strongly to seemingly arbitrarily chosen locations of recent of terror attacks in Paris.
lead_paragraph: The catastrophic events in Paris on Friday put law enforcement agencies on heightened alert, and left people waking up to the weekend in the city coping with a creeping sense of dread.

headline.main: Day After Paris Attacks, Familiar Fear Grips a Wary New York
headline.print_headline: A Day After Attacks, Familiar Fear Grips a Wary New York

snippet: The catastrophic events in Paris on Friday put law enforcement agencies on heightened alert, and left people waking up to the weekend in the city coping with a creeping sense of dread.
